meanings.definition: Shed skin or shell, especially by an animal.
meanings.sent1: After the snake's exuviation, it left behind a perfect skin.
meanings.sent2: The exuviate of the crab was found on the beach.
meanings.sent3: The exuviate of the lizard was mistaken for a real lizard by a curious cat.
meanings.sent4: The exuviate of the insect lay abandoned on the forest floor.
meanings.sent5: The exuviate of the snake was a fascinating find for the young biologist.

meanings.definition: To cast off or shed an outer layer.
meanings.sent1: The snake will exuviate its old skin to reveal a shiny new one.
meanings.sent2: In spring, birds exuviate their feathers to prepare for the warmer weather.
meanings.sent3: The cat watched in amazement as the snake began to exuviate its skin.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she needed to exuviate her old self and start fresh.
meanings.sent5: The trees exuviate their leaves in the autumn, painting the ground with vibrant colors.
